DOC.brief_summary: This prospective , multi-center trial conduct 20 US , Canadian , European Asian center design determine diagnostic performance CT-FLOW ( investigational technology ) coronary compute tomographic angiography ( CCTA ) non-invasive assessment hemodynamic significance coronary lesion , compare direct measurement fractional flow reserve ( FFR ) cardiac catheterization reference standard .
DOC.brief_title: Determination Fractional Flow Reserve Anatomic Computed Tomographic Angiography
DOC.detailed_description: 285 patient , prospective , multi-center trial conduct 20 US , Canadian , European Asian center design determine diagnostic performance CT-FLOW ( investigational technology ) coronary compute tomographic angiography ( CCTA ) non-invasive assessment hemodynamic significance coronary lesion , compare direct measurement fractional flow reserve ( FFR ) cardiac catheterization reference standard
DOC.criteria: Age > 18 year Patients provide write informed consent Scheduled undergo clinicallyindicated nonemergent invasive coronary angiography ( ICA ) Has undergone > 64 multidetector row CCTA within 60 day prior ICA No cardiac interventional therapy CCTA ICA Prior coronary artery bypass graft ( CABG ) surgery Prior percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) suspect coronary artery lesion ( ) within stented coronary vessel Contraindication adenosine , include 2nd 3rd degree heart block ; sick sinus syndrome ; long QT syndrome ; severe hypotension , severe asthma , , severe COPD bronchodilatordependent COPD Suspicion acute coronary syndrome ( acute myocardial infarction unstable angina ) Recent prior myocardial infarction within 40 day ICA Known complex congenital heart disease Prior pacemaker internal defibrillator lead implantation Prosthetic heart valve Significant arrhythmia tachycardia Impaired chronic renal function ( serum creatinine > 1.5 mg/dl Patients know anaphylactic allergy iodinate contrast Pregnancy unknown pregnancy status Body mass index > 35 Patient require emergent procedure Evidence ongoing active clinical instability , include acute chest pain ( sudden onset ) , cardiogenic shock , unstable blood pressure systolic blood pressure < 90 mmHg , severe congestive heart failure ( NYHA III IV ) acute pulmonary edema Any active , serious , lifethreatening disease life expectancy le 2 month Inability comply study procedure
